page.title: 07Eric Burton - Farmer.
page.content: fed twice daily with warm milk, given clean straw to lie on and generally fussed over. The youngest animals having been seen to,I then spend the next two hours going to various parts of the farm to inspect nearly 300 other animals of differing ages to check they are not sick,have not broken any fences and have plenty of food to eat.At some time during the morning I will open the post, invariably make one or two telephone calls and possibly fill in some records. After midday lunch a group of students arrive from the local agricultural College and I instruct them in performing various tasks with the animals.Atthe moment this involves dehorning and castrating calves and ending up giving them their late afternoon feed.At anytime during the
